intro: Lavatera trimestris var. brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stalked lavatera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fluffy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
